title: [COMPLETE] OCE Platform Maintenance - 2017-04-12 @ 0500 AEST
body:
Hi Folks

We'll be doing some planned maintenance on the OCE servers on the morning of Wednesday 12th April.

Ranked Queues will be disabled at 0330 am AEST (Sydney Time)
The servers will be shut down at 0500 AEST for a 4 hour maintenance window, and we're planning to open back up at 0900 AEST.

We'll post here if there are any updates or changes to the plan.

Cheers!
Mindstar

replies.body: Out of curiosity, is this to do with phase 2 of the client rollout?
Its actually not - just timing lines up this time.   We try and slot in server maintenance like this in during the weeks in between game patches, to make sure they don't impact each other.

I have been using Legacy Client until the enforcement of the Alpha Client. I have tried all the settings "low spec mode" "close client while in game" My CPU fan makes a loud noise, fps has dropped from "200 - 300 fps" to like 100 but it fluctuates so much making it harder to play. Ping has risen up by 11 :S 
Really should of kept legacy version until this was 100% completely done ! and don't say its done.

200-300 fps????? You are wasting CPU usage on Graphics enhancement that are not necessary for this game. 

The human eye sees motion from films at 24 fps and cannot tell the difference , anything over that is just overkill (unless you are playing fps type games).  If you are getting fluctuations, the frame rate of 100 fps would not be the cause. 

Your ping rate could be an issue. I use a LAN cable as it gives a more steady and consistent stream than WI-FI does(way less spikes from dropped packets).
In Ulladulla I have a steady 37ms with a 100 Mbps connetion (this is quite reasonable to play this game), in Sydney this drops to 18ms with a 1 Gbps connection using the same computer. 


Hope this helps.

Yeah I was just mentioning that My FPS was much Higher and that Alpha is not optimized. 
Ping has been fine from When OCE had fixed all there problems till Yesterday which is probably 2 years Now. All of a sudden ping has increased. As I said my normal ping was 21, and now it's 35 its definitely different. I have played this game way too long enough to know lolz (7 years) I am using Ethernet. Nothing of mine has changed for the past 2 years besides changing to Alpha Client which i'm beginning to suspect that they run on two different servers. This is probably going to take them very long time to deal with unless they bring back legacy.

Speed test gives 17 latency and use to get 21 ping normally in game,
Also 37 is your normal ping, I'd be use to it as well.  using abilities has a slight rubber band effect which indicates packet loss or server side issue to which I Have already checked.


Thanks for trying to help.
The game client and the splash client are not the same. Even if they were running connections to the splash client on different servers, it would not affect in game ping.

Well I'll see i'm waiting on the support to figure it out, gave them the zip file with all the info (from hextech repair tool). I also skimmed through it and the ping shows 17 in that zip file. There's really nothing much I can do. Either by next patch it will get fixed or this is going to take ages and might need to have a long break sadly.

These problems are native to your client not to Riot, i.e the problem is on your end (that doesn't mean it's your fault of course, there's a lot of things that can cause it). Player support ought to be able to help you nail down the problem, especially with logs the the repair tool and help you fix it.
